Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master Xuanzang on Imperial Order
Chapter 3, Section 2: The First Part, on Being in Accord
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ do not see form as being in accord or not in accord, and do not see feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness as being in accord or not in accord;
They do not see the eye sense base as being in accord or not in accord, and do not see the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind sense bases as being in accord or not in accord;
They do not see the form sense base as being in accord or not in accord, and do not see the sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharma sense bases as being in accord or not in accord;
They do not see the eye element as being in accord or not in accord, and do not see the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind elements as being in accord or not in accord;

He does not see the form realm as associated or unassociated, and he does not see the sound, smell, taste, touch, or dharma realms as associated or unassociated;ğŸ”½He does not see the eye consciousness realm as associated or unassociated, and he does not see the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind consciousness realms as associated or unassociated;
He does not see eye contact as associated or unassociated, and he does not see ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact as associated or unassociated;

He does not see the feelings produced by eye contact as associated or unassociated, and he does not see the feelings produced by ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact as associated or unassociated;
He does not see the earth element as associated or unassociated, and he does not see the water, fire, wind, space, or consciousness elements as associated or unassociated;

They do not see conditions as being associated or not associated, and they do not see the immediately preceding condition, the object-condition, or the dominant condition as being associated or not associated, and they do not see the phenomena produced from conditions as being associated or not associated.

They do not see ignorance as being associated or not associated, and they do not see volitional formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, existence, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress as being associated or not associated.
They do not see the desire realm as being associated or not associated, and they do not see the form realm or the formless realm as being associated or not associated.

They do not see the perfection of giving as being associated or not associated, and they do not see the perfections of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, or wisdom as being associated or not associated.

They do not see internal emptiness as either associated or not associated, and they do not see external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, empty emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, conditioned emptiness, unconditioned emptiness, absolute emptiness, limitless emptiness, dispersed emptiness, unchanging emptiness, inherent emptiness, specific emptiness, general emptiness, all dharmas emptiness, emptiness of non-attainment, nature emptiness, self-nature emptiness, or the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence as either associated or not associated;

They do not see suchness as either associated or not associated, and they do not see the dharma realm, dharma nature, non-false nature, unchanging nature, equality nature, birthlessness nature, dharma determination, dharma abode, reality limit, space realm, or inconceivable realm as either associated or not associated;

They do not see the four establishments of mindfulness as associated or not associated, and they do not see the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of awakening, or eightfold noble path as associated or not associated;
They do not see the noble truth of suffering as associated or not associated, and they do not see the noble truths of the arising, cessation, or path of suffering as associated or not associated;

They do not see the ten wholesome courses of action as associated or not associated, and they do not see the five precepts for lay followers or eight precepts for lay followers as associated or not associated;
They do not see the meritorious deeds of giving as associated or not associated, and they do not see the meritorious deeds of morality or cultivation as associated or not associated;
They do not see the four meditations as associated or not associated, and they do not see the four immeasurable [minds] or four formless concentrations as associated or not associated;

He does not see the eight liberations as being associated or not associated, and he does not see the eight superior [spheres of] perception, the nine successive [meditative] concentrations, or the ten universal bases as being associated or not associated;

He does not see the emptiness of the gateway to liberation as being associated or not associated, and he does not see the signless or wishless gateway to liberation as being associated or not associated;
He does not see all the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways as being associated or not associated, and he does not see all the samÄdhi gateways as being associated or not associated;

He does not see the ground of joy as being associated or not associated, and he does not see the ground of stainlessness, the luminous ground, the radiant ground, the ground of difficult to conquer, the ground of presence, the ground of far-reaching, the immovable ground, the ground of excellent understanding, or the cloud of Dharma ground as being associated or not associated;
He does not see the five eyes as being associated or not associated, and he does not see the six supernormal knowledges as being associated or not associated;

They do not see the ten powers of the Buddha as being associated or not associated, and they do not see the four fearlessnesses, four unimpeded understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, or the eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha as being associated or not associated;
They do not see the thirty-two marks of a great person as being associated or not associated, and they do not see the eighty minor marks as being associated or not associated;

They do not see the dharma of non-forgetfulness as being associated or not associated, and they do not see the nature of constant relinquishment as being associated or not associated;ğŸ”½They do not see omniscience as being associated or not associated, and they do not see the cognition of the characteristics of the path, the cognition of all characteristics, or the subtle cognition of all characteristics as being associated or not associated;

They do not see the cognition of all modes as being associated or not associated, and they do not see the complete uprooting of all propensities of the afflictions as being associated or not associated;

They do not see the fruit of stream-entry as associated or non-associated, they do not see the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, or the fruit of arhatship as associated or non-associated, they do not see pratyekabuddha enlightenment as associated or non-associated, they do not see the practice of all bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas as associated or non-associated, they do not see the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of the buddhas as associated or non-associated;

They do not see self as associated or non-associated, they do not see sentient beings, living beings, born beings, nourished beings, persons, individuals, creators, co-creators, those who cause creation, those who cause something to be created, those who experience, those who cause something to be experienced, those who know, or those who see as associated or non-associated.
ÅšÄriputra!
For this reason, one should know that the practice of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ should be said to be associated with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ do not view emptiness as either associated or unassociated with emptiness, do not view signlessness as either associated or unassociated with signlessness, and do not view wishlessness as either associated or unassociated with wishlessness.
Why is this?
ÅšÄriputra!
Emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are all neither associated nor unassociated.
ÅšÄriputra!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ are associated with such dharmas, and therefore it is said they are associated with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ enter the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of all dharmas, and do not view form as either associated or unassociated, do not view feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness as either associated or unassociated.
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva does not consider form to be either associated with or disassociated from the prior limit.
Why is it so?
Because he does not see the prior limit.
He does not consider feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness to be either associated with or disassociated from the prior limit.
Why is it so?
Because he does not see the prior limit.
He does not consider form to be either associated with or disassociated from the later limit.
Why is it so?
Because he does not see the later limit.
He does not consider feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness to be either associated with or disassociated from the later limit.
Why is it so?
Because he does not see the later limit.
He does not consider form to be either associated with or disassociated from the present.
Why is it so?
Because he does not see the present.
He does not consider feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness to be either associated with or disassociated from the present.
Why is it so?
Because he does not see the present.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ do not consider the past as being associated or not associated with
the future, do not consider the past as being associated or not associated with the present,ğŸ”½do not consider the future as being associated or not associated with the past,
do not consider the future as being associated or not associated with the present, do not consider the present as being associated or not associated with
the past, do not consider the present as being associated or not associated with the future, do not consider the past, future, and present as being associated or not associated with each other,
do not consider the future, past, and present as being associated or not associated with each other,

do not consider the present, past, and future as being associated or not associated with each other, and do not consider the past, future, and present as being associated or not associated with each other.
Why is it so?
ÅšÄriputra!
Because the three times are empty.
ÅšÄriputra!
Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, it is said that they are in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ do not view the knowledge of all modes as being in accordance with or not in accordance with the past.
Why is it so?
One does not even see the past, let alone view the knowledge of all modes as being in accordance with or not in accordance with the past!
They do not view the knowledge of all modes as being in accordance with or not in accordance with the future.
Why is it so?
One does not even see the future, let alone view the knowledge of all modes as being in accordance with or not in accordance with the future!
They do not view the knowledge of all modes as being in accordance with or not in accordance with the present.
Why is it so?
One does not even see the present, let alone observe whether the omniscience is associated with or disassociated from the present!
ÅšÄriputra!
Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, it is said that they are in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, not observing the omniscience as associated with or disassociated from form.
Why is it so?
One does not even see form, let alone observe whether the omniscience is associated with or disassociated from form!
They do not observe the omniscience as associated with or disassociated from feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.
Why is it so?

One does not even see feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness, let alone observe whether the omniscience is associated with or disassociated from feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness!
ÅšÄriputra!
Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, they are said to be in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ without observing the knowledge of all modes as being in union or non-union with the eye sense-sphere.

Because they do not even see the eye sense-sphere, let alone observe the knowledge of all modes as being in union or non-union with the eye sense-sphere!
They do not observe the knowledge of all modes as being in union or non-union with the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind sense-spheres.
Why is it so?

Because they do not even see the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind sense-spheres, let alone observe the knowledge of all modes as being in union or non-union with the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind sense-spheres!
ÅšÄriputra!
Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, they are said to be in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ without observing the all-inclusive knowledge as either associated with or disassociated from the visual faculty.

Because they do not even see the visual faculty, let alone observe the all-inclusive knowledge as either associated with or disassociated from the visual faculty!
They do not observe the all-inclusive knowledge as either associated with or disassociated from the auditory, olfactory, gustatory, tactile, or mental faculties.
Why is it so?

Because they do not even see the auditory, olfactory, gustatory, tactile, or mental faculties, let alone observe the all-inclusive knowledge as either associated with or disassociated from the auditory, olfactory, gustatory, tactile, or mental faculties!

Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, they are said to be in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

Because they do not even see the eye constituent, let alone observe the knowledge of all modes as either associated with or disassociated from the eye constituent!
They do not observe the knowledge of all modes as either associated with or disassociated from the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind constituents.
Why is it so?

Because they do not even see the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind constituents, let alone observe the knowledge of all modes as either associated with or disassociated from the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind constituents!
ÅšÄriputra!
Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, they are said to be in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ without viewing the knowledge of all modes as associated or non-associated with the form aggregate.

One does not even see the form aggregate, let alone viewing the knowledge of all modes as associated or non-associated with the form aggregate!
One does not view the knowledge of all modes as associated or non-associated with the aggregates of feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.
Why is it so?

One does not even see the aggregates of feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness, let alone viewing the knowledge of all modes as associated or non-associated with the aggregates of feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness!
ÅšÄriputra!
Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, they are said to be in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ without observing the knowledge of all modes as being in union or non-union with the eye-consciousness element.

Because they do not even see the eye-consciousness element, let alone observe the knowledge of all modes as being in union or non-union with the eye-consciousness element!
They do not observe the knowledge of all modes as being in union or non-union with the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind consciousness elements.

Because they do not even see the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind consciousness elements, let alone observe the knowledge of all modes as being in union or non-union with the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind consciousness elements!

Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, they are said to be in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ without observing the knowledge of all modes as being in union or non-union with eye-contact.

One does not even see eye-contact, let alone observing the knowledge of all modes as being in union or non-union with eye-contact!
One does not observe the knowledge of all modes as being in union or non-union with ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, or mind-contact.

One does not even see ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, or mind-contact, let alone observing the knowledge of all modes as being in union or non-union with ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, or mind-contact!

Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, they are said to be in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, not observing the all-inclusive knowledge as either associated with or not associated with the feelings that arise from the condition of eye contact.
Why is it so?

Because they do not even see the feelings that arise from the condition of eye contact, let alone observe the all-inclusive knowledge as either associated with or not associated with the feelings that arise from the condition of eye contact!
They do not observe the all-inclusive knowledge as either associated with or not associated with the feelings that arise from the condition of ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact.

They do not see the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact as a condition giving rise to various feelings, let alone contemplate the all-encompassing knowledge as either associated with or unassociated from the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind contact as a condition giving rise to various feelings!
ÅšÄriputra!
Because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ are in accord with such dharmas, it is said they are in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
Furthermore, ÅšÄriputra!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ do not contemplate the all-encompassing knowledge as either associated with or unassociated from the earth element.

They do not see the earth element, let alone contemplate the all-encompassing knowledge as either associated with or unassociated from the earth element!
They do not contemplate the all-encompassing knowledge as either associated with or unassociated from the water, fire, wind, space, or consciousness elements.

ÅšÄriputra!
Because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, it is said that they are in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ do not contemplate all-knowledge as being associated or unassociated with conditions.

They do not contemplate all-knowledge as being associated or unassociated with the causal condition, the condition of equal and immediate succession, the object as condition, or the dominant condition, or with dharmas produced from conditions.
Why is it so?

They do not see the immediately preceding condition, the objective condition, the dominant condition, or dharmas produced from conditions, let alone contemplate the all-encompassing cognition as associated or unassociated with the immediately preceding condition, the objective condition, the dominant condition, or dharmas produced from conditions!
ÅšÄriputra!
Because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ are associated with such dharmas, it is said they are associated with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

They do not view the knowledge of all modes as associated or non-associated with formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression, and distress.
Why is it so?

They do not even see formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression, and distress, let alone view the knowledge of all modes as associated or non-associated with formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression, and distress!
ÅšÄriputra!
Because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, they are said to be in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ do not view the knowledge of all modes as associated or non-associated with the perfection of giving.

They do not observe the all-knowing to be either associated with or disassociated from the perfections of morality, patience, vigor, meditation, or wisdom.

Why is it so?

They do not even see external emptiness up to the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence, let alone view the knowledge of all modes as either associated or unassociated with external emptiness up to the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence!

Because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in accordance with these dharmas, they are said to be in accord with prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
